guided_reframing_meditations.emotion_target: tightness, pressure in the chest, anxiety around authority
guided_awareness: Notice where you feel the urge to defend or explain yourself.
Breathe into that space and ask softly, 'What part of me wants to be safe here?'
reframing_affirmations: I can be connected without surrendering my freedom.
I am safe to be myself even if someone disagrees.
guided_reframing_meditations.gesture_anchor: Place both hands over your heart and feel your chest rise as you breathe in.

guided_reframing_meditations.emotion_target: sadness, heaviness in throat, urge to shut down
guided_awareness: Feel where your body holds the unsaid words.
Let a small sound or sigh release from your throat.
reframing_affirmations: My emotions are signals, not flaws.
Every feeling is a valid part of my truth.
guided_reframing_meditations.gesture_anchor: Rest one hand on your throat and one on your heart as you breathe gently.

guided_reframing_meditations.emotion_target: mental tension, pressure behind eyes, frustration
guided_awareness: Notice your breath when you feel the need to be right or understood.
Ask yourself, 'What would it feel like if both views could exist?'
reframing_affirmations: I can hold space for difference without losing my center.
Truth is spacious — I don’t need to win to be seen.
guided_reframing_meditations.gesture_anchor: Open your palms outward, symbolizing room for multiple truths.

guided_awareness: Feel where shame sits in your body.
Place warmth there with your hand and say, 'You’re safe to exist.'
reframing_affirmations: I release the belief that I must suffer to be good.
I learn through kindness, not punishment.
guided_reframing_meditations.gesture_anchor: One hand on belly, one on heart — breathe compassion between them.

guided_reframing_meditations.emotion_target: loneliness, emptiness in chest, fear of rejection
guided_awareness: Remember a time you felt you had to earn approval.
Whisper to yourself, 'I was already enough.'
reframing_affirmations: I am worthy of love without performance.
My value is not conditional on anyone’s approval.
guided_reframing_meditations.gesture_anchor: Wrap your arms around yourself in a gentle hug.

guided_reframing_meditations.emotion_target: anger, tight shoulders, feeling invaded or tense
guided_awareness: Notice the space around your body — imagine a calm protective field.
Say silently, 'It’s safe to have space.'
reframing_affirmations: My boundaries are acts of love, not rejection.
I can be kind and firm at the same time.
guided_reframing_meditations.gesture_anchor: Visualize a soft light bubble around your body while breathing steadily.

guided_awareness: Notice any heaviness that isn’t truly yours.
Ask gently, 'Whose emotion am I carrying right now?'
reframing_affirmations: I am not responsible for what others project.
I return what is not mine with compassion and clarity.
guided_reframing_meditations.gesture_anchor: Brush your arms downward from shoulders to hands to release outside energy.

guided_reframing_meditations.emotion_target: self-doubt, dizziness, feeling gaslit or uncertain
guided_awareness: Anchor into your senses — feel the floor, see the light, name what’s real right now.
Say, 'My memory and my feelings are trustworthy guides.'
reframing_affirmations: I trust my perception and inner knowing.
I don’t need their validation to confirm my truth.
guided_reframing_meditations.gesture_anchor: Touch your forehead lightly, then your heart, to connect mind and intuition.

guided_reframing_meditations.emotion_target: fear, tension in jaw, suppressed tears
guided_awareness: Breathe into your chest and imagine your heart softening.
Whisper, 'It’s safe to feel.'
reframing_affirmations: Vulnerability is courage in motion.
I can be open and protected at the same time.
guided_reframing_meditations.gesture_anchor: Rest both palms open over your heart center.

guided_reframing_meditations.emotion_target: fear of speaking, shallow breathing, tension in throat
guided_awareness: Notice your breath and the muscles around your mouth and neck.
Let a quiet hum or exhale move through your throat to reopen flow.
reframing_affirmations: My voice deserves gentle space to exist.
Speaking my truth honors my inner child.
guided_reframing_meditations.gesture_anchor: Touch your throat gently while breathing slow and steady.
